sense.name: atomic number 79
sense.commentary: Au - a soft yellow malleable ductile (trivalent and univalent) metallic element; occurs mainly as nuggets in rocks and alluvial deposits; does not react with most chemicals but is attacked by chlorine and aqua regia
sense.examples: I gave him three pieces of gold for that horse. They traded corn for gold. Whilst that for which all virtue now is sold, and almost every vice- almighty gold" -Ben Jonson

sense.name: amber
sense.examples: An amber light illuminated the room. He admired the gold of her hair.

sense.name: like gold
sense.commentary: something likened to the metal in brightness or preciousness or superiority etc.
sense.examples: The child was as good as gold. She has a heart of gold.
